result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica N Grell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/01/2016; alternate 9 days jail. Payment plan fee of $15.00 imposed as well.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Monica N Grell did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for jury status hearing.  Defendant has paid restitution in full.  State moves to amend Count #1 to county theft citation.  No contest plea is entered to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $$456.50 -to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 7/1/16, alternate 9 days jail if not paid.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Request for adjournment filed by defense counsel.

Approved by Judge Maxwell 2/18/16

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Monica N Grell did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have not resolve the matter and are requesting a trial date. Court grants.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Monica N Grell did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to pay the restitution. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Adam Schlies for Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Monica N Grell did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for 60 days for her client to pay restitution. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Stop N Go and its employees as listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Monica N Grell in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
